content.question: For greater stability, the Inka builders of the Walls at Saqsa Waman used

choices.label: uniformly shaped stones connected with mortise and tenon
irregularly sized stones fitted together without any mortar
an inner core of rubble, a layer of stone, and a brick facing
unevenly wrought stones stacked and joined using mortar

content.answer: irregularly sized stones fitted together without any mortar

topic.text: 5.2: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
